document.title: LEVEL 1-­‐4 INDIANA ACADEMIC STANDARDS –MODERN EUROPEAN AND CLASSICAL LANGUAGES

BDE53762F5104FFBA5F9C8BD0857AB86.description: Show evidence of becoming a life-long learner by using the target language  and cultural knowledge for personal  enrichment.

D63831A54AA348C8A51F41919122C328.description: Investigate the influences of the target  language and cultures on the learner’s  own community.

8B26996049664AFC9C629E46813BADC3.description: Share experiences from the world language classroom within the school  and/or community.

93B52A78A2144149BFD96107B83499FF.description: COMMUNITIES: Become an active global citizen by experiencing languages and cultures in multiple settings

4829DDB9117F46CA9B3E2AC0911FBF6B.description: Describe, in the target language,  contributions from the target cultures.

87A820970A974B328232AF4B91D1DA9F.description: Discuss, in the target language, the different celebrations and holidays  of a variety of other cultures and  compare them to those of the  learner’s culture.

5E960C998B36462A9A3EB7E1FA70D840.description: Compare the systems and social   patterns of other cultures and the  learner’s own culture.

B2F299C4DECA4468BB41261ADA3992A4.description: Compare and use authentic forms of  address in familiar social situations,  both formal and informal.

FA5E2D5C7ED149A89F1A2DF2E0E5B0BC.description: Compare and use common idiomatic,  colloquial, and proverbial expressions in the target language.

2CB88FBF003142A1A131329D1E4ED3E4.description: Recognize and use level appropriate  language structures.

E5A87666CD4D47C98C66B648AD8BEF1E.description: Recognize and use cognates and word  families shared between English and  the target language to expand  vocabulary and guess meaning.

5839DF0618AD4AE7BAE9182550D748A4.description: COMPARISONS: Investigate the nature of language and culture

6726BA613A8049078F71601F68600834.description: Use digital media and culturally  authentic resources to study target cultures.

029AAA50799448A6B498CC7093AB5BF7.description: Use digital media and culturally authentic resources to reinforce and expand  vocabulary and improve receptive and productive skills.

42C09CFADD0A4093ADB3D764E3D142BD.description: CONNECTIONS: Access and connect information through various media

11392DF02ED846F8942BAE2F0571EFA8.description: Implement content area concepts and skills through relevant activities. Examples: Write a persuasive speech or essay (English/Language Arts), etc

D730544F8DD449D6BC41AF8546A8943B.description: Investigate and discuss objects and concepts from other content areas. Example:  Famous works of art (Fine Arts), environmental issues (Science), etc.

4E3AA1ECB0C8406FAA73D4AD41E73FF8.description: CONNECTIONS: Make connections to other content areas

D02112AD2EF34DB0B3929F372D8A8A74.description: Perspectives:  Examine culture through literary works from the target language and cultures.

8CC125F694E74729880990A00696689F.description: Perspectives: Describe, in the target language, influences on practices and products, such as concept of time, social etiquette, gender roles, ethnic groups, etc.

820E4BDC35B0449DAABF0B5163D0EE69.description: Products: Describe, in the target language, products of the target cultures, such as fashion, literature, imported products, etc.

C8F7CC96710B4B97864B7CA495591A66.description: Practices: Use situation-appropriate verbal and non-verbal communication.

EE16B15A7F5D4FE58DD5947B48EBEFA7.description: Practices: Describe social and cultural practices in the target language

F2902897FB4F4943B012574672358424.description: CULTURES: Develop awareness of other cultures

A7BCA533328E41778A01B7A0D49AC38F.description: Strategies for Presenting Oral and Written Language:Use transitional and cohesive devices.

BB7B486BF10A452796B8905912257A41.description: Strategies for Presenting Oral and Written Language: Use more complex grammar and syntax with increasing accuracy.

8AD328D2AB5D48F39465A3EE89FBB11A.description: Strategies  for Presenting Oral and         Written Language: Use intonation and pronunciation comprehensible to instructor and classmates with increasing accuracy and fluency

2108ECA188AF4418A0C09824BD8FA6CD.description: Presenting  Written Language: Write longer paragraphs to express a variety of emotions, opinions, or abstract ideas.

C6A8860F9B684AFD8FC00A29E3A4C148.description: Presenting Oral Language: Speak in more complex sentences to express a variety of emotions, opinions, or abstract ideas.

F32E1E26D5E54A01946F5EE3B8C2C21C.description: Presenting Oral Language:  Present material, both rehearsed and impromptu, on a variety of topics.

288DDA1BE63344149427392CB8E1055A.description: COMMUNICATION: Present information in a language other than English. (Presentational)

366177CB980B4E83A4A958DA69EAC75F.description: Strategies for Comprehending Oral and Written Languages:  Use strategies such as contextual guessing, identifying discourse structure, and transitional devices to interpret meaning and purpose.

7CE3078B02AA454D8B2DB8E42164A660.description: Strategies for Comprehending Oral and Written Languages: Use cognates, familiar vocabulary, word families, or cultural context to interpret passages.

26BBE77C9ECC41FABFD3F89265002778.description: Comprehending Written Language: Demonstrate comprehension of longer, more complex passages in the target language by interpreting main ideas and supporting details from familiar text genres

04BCED828EEC41DA9D63C37C9CDB6200.description: Comprehending Oral Language: Demonstrate comprehension of both authentic and non-authentic passages of increasing length and complexity.

C21E302F8C6C41768CEFD2460E466F09.description: Comprehending Oral Language: Understand and respond to requests, commands, and directions of increasing variety and complexity.

0DD444CFB4304D0C89FC1E079C0627F8.description: COMMUNICATION: Interpret information in a language other than English   (Interpretive)

BDE73E5491574B6291F6AF95AD93C138.description: Strategies for Maintaining Oral / Written Exchanges: Use speaking and listening strategies that facilitate communication. Examples: Using synonyms and antonyms, using circumlocution, paraphrasing

AB3D9942D76B44C7AA117770772768E7.description: Written Request for Information: Make requests and ask different types of questions in a variety of familiar social situations.

FB47CA3DFC6549668554C4CF7704115B.description: Written Expression: Exchange detailed information and opinions on familiar topics.

822FA340CA3046DE999584A36D913DA2.description: Oral Request for Information: Make requests and ask different types of questions in a variety of familiar situations.

C6B247DA634F4F54B446C5D7516C93B3.description: Oral Expression:  Exchange detailed information and options on familiar topics

F5E736EDF4474664A94A271292C2A49F.description: Oral Expression: Initiate, sustain, and close brief conversations in familiar social situations both formal and informal

6616CD9925534941BD5A2DFCE2F3FB2E.description: COMMUNICATION: Write and speak in a language other than English  (Interpersonal)
